## Master of Science: Biostatistics
The University of Michigan, School of Public Health, Ann Arbor, Michigan

- **Graduated:** May 2020    
- **GPA:** 4.00
- Richard G. Cornell Fellowship recipient for outstanding academic performance
- **Research Assitantship Advisor:** [Dr. Matthew Schipper](https://sph.umich.edu/faculty-profiles/schipper-matthew.html)  
- **Research and Academic Advisors:** [Dr. Kelley Kidwell](https://sph.umich.edu/faculty-profiles/kidwell-kelley.html), [Dr. Thomas Braun](https://sph.umich.edu/faculty-profiles/braun-thomas.html)

## Tips for Michigan students in biostatistics

- Consider participating in a [SIBS](https://www.nhlbi.nih.gov/node-general/summer-institute-biostatistics) program before applying.   
    + If you're already at Michigan, get involved with the [Big Data Summer Institute (BDSI)](https://sph.umich.edu/bdsi/) as a current student coordinator. It is rewarding and fun!   
- Be comfortable with coding in R or SAS.     
- Make sure you have hobbies and a support system outside of your graduate program.
